body_content.explanation: a diamond (= a transparent precious stone) that has been mined (= taken out of the ground) in an area where there is war or fighting, and that is sold to get money to continue the fighting:
examples: The campaign to clean up gold mines echoes the opposition to "blood diamonds", sold to finance conflicts in developing nations.
A multinational conference this week may agree to a protocol that would stem the trade in "conflict diamonds"—gems used to finance rebel insurgencies in various parts of Africa.
